channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024021923
item.description:
Report X-2024021923

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was damaged by a forklift. The fiberboard boxes were overpacked and shrink wrapped on 2 identical wooden pallets. The damaged box and 4 other boxes that were leaked on, were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper. Both pallets had 1 box that was damaged. Inner contents of each box were 4 plastic bottles. 1 inner bottle was damaged on pallet#1 Trk#775084501879. 2 plastic bottles were damaged in one box on pallet #5, Trk#775084502706. Total damage between the pallets is 15 Liters. The packages have been placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024021846
item.description:
Report X-2024021846

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in puddle of its leaking contents. Package appeared to have been leaking from top at one point, suggesting the package was loaded incorrectly. Package placed in hazmat spill tote, spillage cleaned up with spill absorbent powder. DescribePack: Package was wet on top and bottom corners. Upon inspection, 1 jug of Wash Brite was found to have a loose cap, causing contents to leak out and onto remaining jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in spill tote and placed in hazmat processing area, spillage cleaned with spill absorbent powder. No contact was made with skin of any present.

item.title: Report X-2024021878
item.description:
Report X-2024021878

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Several attempts were made to deliver package to recipient. After lasted attempt, can inside box was dented inside facility and liquid began leaking from can and through box. Box was moved to a damage hazmat tote and taken to damage package area for processing. Very little liquid leaked and amount which did evaporated immediately. DescribePack: Bottom of can was dented causing it to pull away from sides of can, resulting in the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was immediately placed upside down in a damage hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021397
item.description:
Report X-2024021397

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED METAL DRUM NOTICEABLY WET. CONTENTS OF 1 X 5 GALLON METAL PAIL "UN1263 PAINT" (FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS), FAILED AT TOP LID. LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS CAUSING ENTIRE PACKAGE TO FAIL. DEEMED DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024021271
item.description:
Report X-2024021271

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 3rd a package was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The package contained 1805, Phosphoric acid, solution, 8, III, the inner glass receptacle broke, causing the entire contents to leak. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and will be sent for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021396
item.description:
Report X-2024021396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. CONTENTS DEEMED AS; 2 X 1 US GALLON CANS OF RESIN SOLUTION (UN1866). PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, AND FAILED AT TOP LID. INTERNAL LEAKAGE FAILED PACKAGE ENTIRELY. PAINT CANS ARE DENTED, DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024021312
item.description:
Report X-2024021312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: MARION
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SIX PKGS ARRIVED ALL WITH SAME TRACKING NUMBER. AUDITOR CONTACTED HMSC AND CONFIRMED UNDECLARED. NON-LEAKING PACKAGE WITH NO DAMAGE DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED COMFIRM WITH HMSC. YOU COULD PARTIALLY SEE NOVELTY FIREWORKS IN HOLES IN THE BANANA BOXES BEING USED. THE CENTER REMOVED THE BROWN TAPE ON A COUPLE OF THE BOXES AND THERE IS A PARTIAL NOVELTY STATEMENT ON THE THERMAL LABELS.
